com.hazelcast.internal.networking

Interface OutboundFrame

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TextCommand
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTextCommand, BulkGetCommand, ClientMessage, DeleteCommand, ErrorCommand, GetCommand, HttpCommand, HttpDeleteCommand, HttpGetCommand, HttpHeadCommand, HttpPostCommand, IncrementCommand, NoOpCommand, Packet, SetCommand, SimpleCommand, StatsCommand, TouchCommand, VersionCommand

    public interface OutboundFrame
    Represents a payload to can be written to a Channel There are different types of OutboundFrame:
    1. Packet: for member to member and old-client to member communication
    2. TextMessage: for memcached and rest communication
    3. ClientMessage: for the new client to member communication
    Till so far, all communication over a single connection, will be of a single Frame-class. E.g. member to member only uses Packets. There is no need for an InboundFrame interface.
    See Also:
    Data, Channel.write(OutboundFrame)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFrameLength()
      Returns the frame length.
      boolean isUrgent()
      Checks if this Frame is urgent.

    • Method Detail

      • isUrgent

        boolean isUrgent()
        Checks if this Frame is urgent. Frames that are urgent, have priority above regular frames. This is useful to implement System Operations so that they can be send faster than regular operations; especially when the system is under load you want these operations have precedence.
        Returns:
        true if urgent, false otherwise.

      • getFrameLength

        int getFrameLength()
        Returns the frame length. This includes header and payload size.
        Returns:
        The frame length.
